Patient Particulars: Name: Laura; Age: 17 years; Sex: Female; Education: High school
History: Present history: Client is a senior in high school with ambitious plans for her future; Family: She family consists of her mother, father and a sister; Personal history: Social relations- She is able to make and sustain relationships with friends and family; Substance use history: She consumes 1-2 drinks of alcohol occasionally.
Current Mental Status Examination: General behavior: Rapport formation initiated and was established, she was cooperative; Mood: Calm; Affect: Broad
Issues discussed in Current Session: Session was around exploring substance use history and habits of the client. It was established that client doesn't misuse the substance.
Reflections by the therapist: Client is ambitious and well aware of use and misuse of alcohol. She was quite comfortable with the idea of quitting alcohol completely in the near future.
Action Plan: Client has to abstain from drinking in the next party she attends. Some ways avoiding drinking while being in a social setup were also discussed, like carrying empty an or own/ preferred drink to the party and sticking to it, or initiating activities or plans which do not involve alcohol.
